Name: Sanitation Commissioner Powers, Snow etc.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the powers of the commissioner of sanitation during snow and other emergencies.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1. Section 16-126 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:
	�16-126 Snow removal; employees and equipment. a. In case of a snowfall or other emergency, the commissioner may employ and hire temporarily as many persons, vehicles, machinery and equipment as shall be rendered necessary by such emergency, forthwith reporting, in the case of a snowfall, the number of such persons, vehicles, machinery and equipment and in the case of any other emergency such action with the full particulars thereof to the mayor[, but in]. In the case of a snowfall [no] or any other emergency such [person] persons, vehicles, machinery or equipment shall be [so hired or] employed or hired for [a longer period than seven days and in the case of any other emergency for a longer period than three days] such period of time as shall be rendered necessary by such emergency.
	b. All such [employees] persons temporarily employed shall be employed directly by the department and not through contractors or other persons, unless the commissioner shall determine that this requirement must for proper action in a particular instance be dispensed with.
	c. The services of any person temporarily employed, and of vehicles, machinery and equipment hired pursuant to this section, shall be paid for in full and directly by the department[, at such times as may be] pursuant to any policy or procedure prescribed by the commissioner.
	d. In all emergency work performed by laborers in the removal of snow where [workers] such laborers are engaged by the hour or day by a contractor employed for the purpose, such [work] laborers shall be paid for their services in full and directly [to those individuals employed on it, in the currency of the United States and not by check or ticket. Every contractor engaged in the removal of snow shall be required to stipulate with the commissioner or others empowered to enter into contracts for that purpose, as the case may be, to observe the provisions of this subdivision, a violation of which shall be deemed to abrogate any such contract] by the contractor, who shall be responsible for payment to such laborers of wages in accordance with applicable law.
	�2. This local law shall take effect immediately.
